thread.title: Beilein: Irvin should be able to practice by start of season
thread.title_full: Beilein: Irvin should be able to practice by start of season

title: Beilein: Irvin should be able to practice by start of season
text:
Michigan coach John Beilein says Zak Irvin should be able to practice by start of season THE ASSOCIATED PRESS   6:40   6:41   
People: 
Michigan (860) 

ANN ARBOR, Michigan — Michigan coach John Beilein says swingman Zak Irvin should at least be back on the practice court by the start of the season. 
The school announced Sept. 9 that Irvin was having back surgery and would miss six to eight weeks. The Wolverines open the season Nov. 13 against Northern Michigan. 
Beilein says Irvin should be "on the court, either in practice or in games, by the start of the season." 
Friday was the first official day of practice for Michigan. Caris LeVert, Derrick Walton and Spike Albrecht, all of whom are returning from injuries, were able to participate. Beilein says LeVert and Walton are back to 100 percent. 
Irvin led the Wolverines in points and minutes last season. LeVert led Michigan in scoring average.
